9#ifndef WPA_CTRL_H
10#define WPA_CTRL_H
11
12#ifdef __cplusplus
13extern "C" {
14#endif
15
16/* wpa_supplicant control interface - fixed message prefixes */
17
18/** Interactive request for identity/password/pin */
19#define WPA_CTRL_REQ "CTRL-REQ-"
20
21/** Response to identity/password/pin request */
22#define WPA_CTRL_RSP "CTRL-RSP-"
23
24/* Event messages with fixed prefix */
25/** Authentication completed successfully and data connection enabled */
26#define WPA_EVENT_CONNECTED "CTRL-EVENT-CONNECTED "
27/** Disconnected, data connection is not available */
28#define WPA_EVENT_DISCONNECTED "CTRL-EVENT-DISCONNECTED "
29/** Association rejected during connection attempt */
30#define WPA_EVENT_ASSOC_REJECT "CTRL-EVENT-ASSOC-REJECT "
31/** Authentication rejected during connection attempt */
32#define WPA_EVENT_AUTH_REJECT "CTRL-EVENT-AUTH-REJECT "
33/** wpa_supplicant is exiting */
34#define WPA_EVENT_TERMINATING "CTRL-EVENT-TERMINATING "
35/** Password change was completed successfully */
36#define WPA_EVENT_PASSWORD_CHANGED "CTRL-EVENT-PASSWORD-CHANGED "
37/** EAP-Request/Notification received */
38#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_NOTIFICATION "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-NOTIFICATION "
39/** EAP authentication started (EAP-Request/Identity received) */
40#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_STARTED "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-STARTED "
41/** EAP method proposed by the server */
42#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_PROPOSED_METHOD "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-PROPOSED-METHOD "
43/** EAP method selected */
44#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_METHOD "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-METHOD "
45/** EAP peer certificate from TLS */
46#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_PEER_CERT "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-PEER-CERT "
47/** EAP peer certificate alternative subject name component from TLS */
48#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_PEER_ALT "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-PEER-ALT "
49/** EAP TLS certificate chain validation error */
50#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_TLS_CERT_ERROR "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-TLS-CERT-ERROR "
51/** EAP status */
52#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_STATUS "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-STATUS "
53/** Retransmit the previous request packet */
54#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_RETRANSMIT "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-RETRANSMIT "
55#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_RETRANSMIT2 "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-RETRANSMIT2 "
56/** EAP authentication completed successfully */
57#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_SUCCESS "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-SUCCESS "
58#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_SUCCESS2 "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-SUCCESS2 "
59/** EAP authentication failed (EAP-Failure received) */
60#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_FAILURE "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-FAILURE "
61#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_FAILURE2 "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-FAILURE2 "
62/** EAP authentication failed due to no response received */
63#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_TIMEOUT_FAILURE "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-TIMEOUT-FAILURE "
64#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_TIMEOUT_FAILURE2 "CTRL-EVENT-EAP-TIMEOUT-FAILURE2 "
65#define WPA_EVENT_EAP_ERROR_CODE "EAP-ERROR-CODE "
66/** Network block temporarily disabled (e.g., due to authentication failure) */
67#define WPA_EVENT_TEMP_DISABLED "CTRL-EVENT-SSID-TEMP-DISABLED "
68/** Temporarily disabled network block re-enabled */
69#define WPA_EVENT_REENABLED "CTRL-EVENT-SSID-REENABLED "
70/** New scan started */
71#define WPA_EVENT_SCAN_STARTED "CTRL-EVENT-SCAN-STARTED "
72/** New scan results available */
73#define WPA_EVENT_SCAN_RESULTS "CTRL-EVENT-SCAN-RESULTS "
74/** Scan command failed */
75#define WPA_EVENT_SCAN_FAILED "CTRL-EVENT-SCAN-FAILED "
76/** wpa_supplicant state change */
77#define WPA_EVENT_STATE_CHANGE "CTRL-EVENT-STATE-CHANGE "
78/** A new BSS entry was added (followed by BSS entry id and BSSID) */
79#define WPA_EVENT_BSS_ADDED "CTRL-EVENT-BSS-ADDED "
80/** A BSS entry was removed (followed by BSS entry id and BSSID) */
81#define WPA_EVENT_BSS_REMOVED "CTRL-EVENT-BSS-REMOVED "
82/** No suitable network was found */
83#define WPA_EVENT_NETWORK_NOT_FOUND "CTRL-EVENT-NETWORK-NOT-FOUND "
84/** Change in the signal level was reported by the driver */
85#define WPA_EVENT_SIGNAL_CHANGE "CTRL-EVENT-SIGNAL-CHANGE "
86/** Beacon loss reported by the driver */
87#define WPA_EVENT_BEACON_LOSS "CTRL-EVENT-BEACON-LOSS "
88/** Regulatory domain channel */
89#define WPA_EVENT_REGDOM_CHANGE "CTRL-EVENT-REGDOM-CHANGE "
90/** Channel switch (followed by freq=<MHz> and other channel parameters) */
91#define WPA_EVENT_CHANNEL_SWITCH "CTRL-EVENT-CHANNEL-SWITCH "
92/** SAE authentication failed due to unknown password identifier */
93#define WPA_EVENT_SAE_UNKNOWN_PASSWORD_IDENTIFIER \
94 "CTRL-EVENT-SAE-UNKNOWN-PASSWORD-IDENTIFIER "
95
96/** IP subnet status change notification
97 *
98 * When using an offloaded roaming mechanism where driver/firmware takes care
99 * of roaming and IP subnet validation checks post-roaming, this event can
100 * indicate whether IP subnet has changed.
101 *
102 * The event has a status=<0/1/2> parameter where
103 * 0 = unknown
104 * 1 = IP subnet unchanged (can continue to use the old IP address)
105 * 2 = IP subnet changed (need to get a new IP address)
106 */
107#define WPA_EVENT_SUBNET_STATUS_UPDATE "CTRL-EVENT-SUBNET-STATUS-UPDATE "
108
109/** RSN IBSS 4-way handshakes completed with specified peer */
110#define IBSS_RSN_COMPLETED "IBSS-RSN-COMPLETED "
111
112/** Notification of frequency conflict due to a concurrent operation.
113 *
114 * The indicated network is disabled and needs to be re-enabled before it can
115 * be used again.
116 */
117#define WPA_EVENT_FREQ_CONFLICT "CTRL-EVENT-FREQ-CONFLICT "
118/** Frequency ranges that the driver recommends to avoid */
119#define WPA_EVENT_AVOID_FREQ "CTRL-EVENT-AVOID-FREQ "
120/** WPS overlap detected in PBC mode */
121#define WPS_EVENT_OVERLAP "WPS-OVERLAP-DETECTED "
122/** Available WPS AP with active PBC found in scan results */
123#define WPS_EVENT_AP_AVAILABLE_PBC "WPS-AP-AVAILABLE-PBC "
124/** Available WPS AP with our address as authorized in scan results */
125#define WPS_EVENT_AP_AVAILABLE_AUTH "WPS-AP-AVAILABLE-AUTH "
126/** Available WPS AP with recently selected PIN registrar found in scan results
127 */
128#define WPS_EVENT_AP_AVAILABLE_PIN "WPS-AP-AVAILABLE-PIN "
129/** Available WPS AP found in scan results */
130#define WPS_EVENT_AP_AVAILABLE "WPS-AP-AVAILABLE "
131/** A new credential received */
132#define WPS_EVENT_CRED_RECEIVED "WPS-CRED-RECEIVED "
133/** M2D received */
134#define WPS_EVENT_M2D "WPS-M2D "
135/** WPS registration failed after M2/M2D */
136#define WPS_EVENT_FAIL "WPS-FAIL "
137/** WPS registration completed successfully */
138#define WPS_EVENT_SUCCESS "WPS-SUCCESS "
139/** WPS enrollment attempt timed out and was terminated */
140#define WPS_EVENT_TIMEOUT "WPS-TIMEOUT "
141/* PBC mode was activated */
142#define WPS_EVENT_ACTIVE "WPS-PBC-ACTIVE "
143/* PBC mode was disabled */
144#define WPS_EVENT_DISABLE "WPS-PBC-DISABLE "
145
146#define WPS_EVENT_ENROLLEE_SEEN "WPS-ENROLLEE-SEEN "
147
148#define WPS_EVENT_OPEN_NETWORK "WPS-OPEN-NETWORK "
149
150/* WPS ER events */
151#define WPS_EVENT_ER_AP_ADD "WPS-ER-AP-ADD "
152#define WPS_EVENT_ER_AP_REMOVE "WPS-ER-AP-REMOVE "
153#define WPS_EVENT_ER_ENROLLEE_ADD "WPS-ER-ENROLLEE-ADD "
154#define WPS_EVENT_ER_ENROLLEE_REMOVE "WPS-ER-ENROLLEE-REMOVE "
155#define WPS_EVENT_ER_AP_SETTINGS "WPS-ER-AP-SETTINGS "
156#define WPS_EVENT_ER_SET_SEL_REG "WPS-ER-AP-SET-SEL-REG "
157
158/* DPP events */
159#define DPP_EVENT_AUTH_SUCCESS "DPP-AUTH-SUCCESS "
160#define DPP_EVENT_AUTH_INIT_FAILED "DPP-AUTH-INIT-FAILED "
161#define DPP_EVENT_NOT_COMPATIBLE "DPP-NOT-COMPATIBLE "
162#define DPP_EVENT_RESPONSE_PENDING "DPP-RESPONSE-PENDING "
163#define DPP_EVENT_SCAN_PEER_QR_CODE "DPP-SCAN-PEER-QR-CODE "
164#define DPP_EVENT_AUTH_DIRECTION "DPP-AUTH-DIRECTION "
165#define DPP_EVENT_CONF_RECEIVED "DPP-CONF-RECEIVED "
166#define DPP_EVENT_CONF_SENT "DPP-CONF-SENT "
167#define DPP_EVENT_CONF_FAILED "DPP-CONF-FAILED "
168#define DPP_EVENT_CONFOBJ_AKM "DPP-CONFOBJ-AKM "
169#define DPP_EVENT_CONFOBJ_SSID "DPP-CONFOBJ-SSID "
170#define DPP_EVENT_CONFOBJ_PASS "DPP-CONFOBJ-PASS "
171#define DPP_EVENT_CONFOBJ_PSK "DPP-CONFOBJ-PSK "
172#define DPP_EVENT_CONNECTOR "DPP-CONNECTOR "
173#define DPP_EVENT_C_SIGN_KEY "DPP-C-SIGN-KEY "
174#define DPP_EVENT_NET_ACCESS_KEY "DPP-NET-ACCESS-KEY "
175#define DPP_EVENT_MISSING_CONNECTOR "DPP-MISSING-CONNECTOR "
176#define DPP_EVENT_NETWORK_ID "DPP-NETWORK-ID "
177#define DPP_EVENT_RX "DPP-RX "
178#define DPP_EVENT_TX "DPP-TX "
179#define DPP_EVENT_TX_STATUS "DPP-TX-STATUS "
180#define DPP_EVENT_FAIL "DPP-FAIL "
181#define DPP_EVENT_PKEX_T_LIMIT "DPP-PKEX-T-LIMIT "
182#define DPP_EVENT_INTRO "DPP-INTRO "
183#define DPP_EVENT_CONF_REQ_RX "DPP-CONF-REQ-RX "
184
185/* MESH events */
186#define MESH_GROUP_STARTED "MESH-GROUP-STARTED "
187#define MESH_GROUP_REMOVED "MESH-GROUP-REMOVED "
188#define MESH_PEER_CONNECTED "MESH-PEER-CONNECTED "
189#define MESH_PEER_DISCONNECTED "MESH-PEER-DISCONNECTED "
190/** Mesh SAE authentication failure. Wrong password suspected. */
191#define MESH_SAE_AUTH_FAILURE "MESH-SAE-AUTH-FAILURE "
192#define MESH_SAE_AUTH_BLOCKED "MESH-SAE-AUTH-BLOCKED "

197#define WMM_AC_EVENT_TSPEC_REQ_FAILED "TSPEC-REQ-FAILED "

199/** P2P device found */
200#define P2P_EVENT_DEVICE_FOUND "P2P-DEVICE-FOUND "
201
202/** P2P device lost */
203#define P2P_EVENT_DEVICE_LOST "P2P-DEVICE-LOST "
204
205/** A P2P device requested GO negotiation, but we were not ready to start the
206 * negotiation */
207#define P2P_EVENT_GO_NEG_REQUEST "P2P-GO-NEG-REQUEST "
208#define P2P_EVENT_GO_NEG_SUCCESS "P2P-GO-NEG-SUCCESS "
209#define P2P_EVENT_GO_NEG_FAILURE "P2P-GO-NEG-FAILURE "
210#define P2P_EVENT_GROUP_FORMATION_SUCCESS "P2P-GROUP-FORMATION-SUCCESS "
211#define P2P_EVENT_GROUP_FORMATION_FAILURE "P2P-GROUP-FORMATION-FAILURE "
212#define P2P_EVENT_GROUP_STARTED "P2P-GROUP-STARTED "
213#define P2P_EVENT_GROUP_REMOVED "P2P-GROUP-REMOVED "
214#define P2P_EVENT_CROSS_CONNECT_ENABLE "P2P-CROSS-CONNECT-ENABLE "
215#define P2P_EVENT_CROSS_CONNECT_DISABLE "P2P-CROSS-CONNECT-DISABLE "
216/* parameters: <peer address> <PIN> */
217#define P2P_EVENT_PROV_DISC_SHOW_PIN "P2P-PROV-DISC-SHOW-PIN "
218/* parameters: <peer address> */
219#define P2P_EVENT_PROV_DISC_ENTER_PIN "P2P-PROV-DISC-ENTER-PIN "
220/* parameters: <peer address> */
221#define P2P_EVENT_PROV_DISC_PBC_REQ "P2P-PROV-DISC-PBC-REQ "
222/* parameters: <peer address> */
223#define P2P_EVENT_PROV_DISC_PBC_RESP "P2P-PROV-DISC-PBC-RESP "
224/* parameters: <peer address> <status> */
225#define P2P_EVENT_PROV_DISC_FAILURE "P2P-PROV-DISC-FAILURE"
226/* parameters: <freq> <src addr> <dialog token> <update indicator> <TLVs> */
227#define P2P_EVENT_SERV_DISC_REQ "P2P-SERV-DISC-REQ "
228/* parameters: <src addr> <update indicator> <TLVs> */
229#define P2P_EVENT_SERV_DISC_RESP "P2P-SERV-DISC-RESP "
230#define P2P_EVENT_SERV_ASP_RESP "P2P-SERV-ASP-RESP "
231#define P2P_EVENT_INVITATION_RECEIVED "P2P-INVITATION-RECEIVED "
232#define P2P_EVENT_INVITATION_RESULT "P2P-INVITATION-RESULT "
233#define P2P_EVENT_INVITATION_ACCEPTED "P2P-INVITATION-ACCEPTED "
234#define P2P_EVENT_FIND_STOPPED "P2P-FIND-STOPPED "
235#define P2P_EVENT_PERSISTENT_PSK_FAIL "P2P-PERSISTENT-PSK-FAIL id="
236#define P2P_EVENT_PRESENCE_RESPONSE "P2P-PRESENCE-RESPONSE "
237#define P2P_EVENT_NFC_BOTH_GO "P2P-NFC-BOTH-GO "
238#define P2P_EVENT_NFC_PEER_CLIENT "P2P-NFC-PEER-CLIENT "
239#define P2P_EVENT_NFC_WHILE_CLIENT "P2P-NFC-WHILE-CLIENT "
240#define P2P_EVENT_FALLBACK_TO_GO_NEG "P2P-FALLBACK-TO-GO-NEG "
241#define P2P_EVENT_FALLBACK_TO_GO_NEG_ENABLED "P2P-FALLBACK-TO-GO-NEG-ENABLED "
242
243/* parameters: <PMF enabled> <timeout in ms> <Session Information URL> */
244#define ESS_DISASSOC_IMMINENT "ESS-DISASSOC-IMMINENT "
245#define P2P_EVENT_REMOVE_AND_REFORM_GROUP "P2P-REMOVE-AND-REFORM-GROUP "

267#define GAS_QUERY_DONE "GAS-QUERY-DONE "

291/* hostapd control interface - fixed message prefixes */
292#define WPS_EVENT_PIN_NEEDED "WPS-PIN-NEEDED "
293#define WPS_EVENT_NEW_AP_SETTINGS "WPS-NEW-AP-SETTINGS "
294#define WPS_EVENT_REG_SUCCESS "WPS-REG-SUCCESS "
295#define WPS_EVENT_AP_SETUP_LOCKED "WPS-AP-SETUP-LOCKED "
296#define WPS_EVENT_AP_SETUP_UNLOCKED "WPS-AP-SETUP-UNLOCKED "
297#define WPS_EVENT_AP_PIN_ENABLED "WPS-AP-PIN-ENABLED "
298#define WPS_EVENT_AP_PIN_DISABLED "WPS-AP-PIN-DISABLED "
299#define AP_STA_CONNECTED "AP-STA-CONNECTED "
300#define AP_STA_DISCONNECTED "AP-STA-DISCONNECTED "
301#define AP_STA_POSSIBLE_PSK_MISMATCH "AP-STA-POSSIBLE-PSK-MISMATCH "
302#define AP_STA_POLL_OK "AP-STA-POLL-OK "
303
304#define AP_REJECTED_MAX_STA "AP-REJECTED-MAX-STA "
305#define AP_REJECTED_BLOCKED_STA "AP-REJECTED-BLOCKED-STA "
306

308#define HS20_T_C_FILTERING_REMOVE "HS20-T-C-FILTERING-REMOVE "
309
310#define AP_EVENT_ENABLED "AP-ENABLED "
311#define AP_EVENT_DISABLED "AP-DISABLED "
312
313#define INTERFACE_ENABLED "INTERFACE-ENABLED "
314#define INTERFACE_DISABLED "INTERFACE-DISABLED "
315
316#define ACS_EVENT_STARTED "ACS-STARTED "
317#define ACS_EVENT_COMPLETED "ACS-COMPLETED "
318#define ACS_EVENT_FAILED "ACS-FAILED "

332/* BSS Transition Management Response frame received */
333#define BSS_TM_RESP "BSS-TM-RESP "
334
335/* Collocated Interference Request frame received;
336 * parameters: <dialog token> <automatic report enabled> <report timeout> */
337#define COLOC_INTF_REQ "COLOC-INTF-REQ "
338/* Collocated Interference Report frame received;
339 * parameters: <STA address> <dialog token> <hexdump of report elements> */
340#define COLOC_INTF_REPORT "COLOC-INTF-REPORT "
341
342/* MBO IE with cellular data connection preference received */
343#define MBO_CELL_PREFERENCE "MBO-CELL-PREFERENCE "
344
345/* BSS Transition Management Request received with MBO transition reason */
346#define MBO_TRANSITION_REASON "MBO-TRANSITION-REASON "
347
348/* parameters: <STA address> <dialog token> <ack=0/1> */
349#define BEACON_REQ_TX_STATUS "BEACON-REQ-TX-STATUS "
350/* parameters: <STA address> <dialog token> <report mode> <beacon report> */
351#define BEACON_RESP_RX "BEACON-RESP-RX "
352
353/* PMKSA cache entry added; parameters: <BSSID> <network_id> */
354#define PMKSA_CACHE_ADDED "PMKSA-CACHE-ADDED "
355/* PMKSA cache entry removed; parameters: <BSSID> <network_id> */
356#define PMKSA_CACHE_REMOVED "PMKSA-CACHE-REMOVED "
357
358/* FILS HLP Container receive; parameters: dst=<addr> src=<addr> frame=<hexdump>
359 */
360#define FILS_HLP_RX "FILS-HLP-RX "
361
362/* Event to indicate Probe Request frame;
363 * parameters: sa=<STA MAC address> signal=<signal> */
364#define RX_PROBE_REQUEST "RX-PROBE-REQUEST "
365
366/* Event to indicate station's HT/VHT operation mode change information */
367#define STA_OPMODE_MAX_BW_CHANGED "STA-OPMODE-MAX-BW-CHANGED "
368#define STA_OPMODE_SMPS_MODE_CHANGED "STA-OPMODE-SMPS-MODE-CHANGED "
369#define STA_OPMODE_N_SS_CHANGED "STA-OPMODE-N_SS-CHANGED "
370
371/* New interface addition or removal for 4addr WDS SDA */
372#define WDS_STA_INTERFACE_ADDED "WDS-STA-INTERFACE-ADDED "
373#define WDS_STA_INTERFACE_REMOVED "WDS-STA-INTERFACE-REMOVED "
374
375/* BSS command information masks */
376
377#define WPA_BSS_MASK_ALL 0xFFFDFFFF
378#define WPA_BSS_MASK_ID BIT(0)
379#define WPA_BSS_MASK_BSSID BIT(1)
380#define WPA_BSS_MASK_FREQ BIT(2)
381#define WPA_BSS_MASK_BEACON_INT BIT(3)
382#define WPA_BSS_MASK_CAPABILITIES BIT(4)
383#define WPA_BSS_MASK_QUAL BIT(5)
384#define WPA_BSS_MASK_NOISE BIT(6)
385#define WPA_BSS_MASK_LEVEL BIT(7)
386#define WPA_BSS_MASK_TSF BIT(8)
387#define WPA_BSS_MASK_AGE BIT(9)
388#define WPA_BSS_MASK_IE BIT(10)
389#define WPA_BSS_MASK_FLAGS BIT(11)
390#define WPA_BSS_MASK_SSID BIT(12)
391#define WPA_BSS_MASK_WPS_SCAN BIT(13)
392#define WPA_BSS_MASK_P2P_SCAN BIT(14)
393#define WPA_BSS_MASK_INTERNETW BIT(15)
394#define WPA_BSS_MASK_WIFI_DISPLAY BIT(16)
395#define WPA_BSS_MASK_DELIM BIT(17)
396#define WPA_BSS_MASK_MESH_SCAN BIT(18)
397#define WPA_BSS_MASK_SNR BIT(19)
398#define WPA_BSS_MASK_EST_THROUGHPUT BIT(20)
399#define WPA_BSS_MASK_FST BIT(21)
400#define WPA_BSS_MASK_UPDATE_IDX BIT(22)
401#define WPA_BSS_MASK_BEACON_IE BIT(23)
402#define WPA_BSS_MASK_FILS_INDICATION BIT(24)
403
404
405/* VENDOR_ELEM_* frame id values */
406enum wpa_vendor_elem_frame {
407 VENDOR_ELEM_PROBE_REQ_P2P = 0,
408 VENDOR_ELEM_PROBE_RESP_P2P = 1,
409 VENDOR_ELEM_PROBE_RESP_P2P_GO = 2,
410 VENDOR_ELEM_BEACON_P2P_GO = 3,
411 VENDOR_ELEM_P2P_PD_REQ = 4,
412 VENDOR_ELEM_P2P_PD_RESP = 5,
413 VENDOR_ELEM_P2P_GO_NEG_REQ = 6,
414 VENDOR_ELEM_P2P_GO_NEG_RESP = 7,
415 VENDOR_ELEM_P2P_GO_NEG_CONF = 8,
416 VENDOR_ELEM_P2P_INV_REQ = 9,
417 VENDOR_ELEM_P2P_INV_RESP = 10,
418 VENDOR_ELEM_P2P_ASSOC_REQ = 11,
419 VENDOR_ELEM_P2P_ASSOC_RESP = 12,
420 VENDOR_ELEM_ASSOC_REQ = 13,
421 VENDOR_ELEM_PROBE_REQ = 14,
422 NUM_VENDOR_ELEM_FRAMES
423};
424
425
426/* wpa_supplicant/hostapd control interface access */
427
428/**
429 * wpa_ctrl_open - Open a control interface to wpa_supplicant/hostapd
430 * @ctrl_path: Path for UNIX domain sockets; ignored if UDP sockets are used.
431 * Returns: Pointer to abstract control interface data or %NULL on failure
432 *
433 * This function is used to open a control interface to wpa_supplicant/hostapd.
434 * ctrl_path is usually /var/run/wpa_supplicant or /var/run/hostapd. This path
435 * is configured in wpa_supplicant/hostapd and other programs using the control
436 * interface need to use matching path configuration.
437 */
438struct wpa_ctrl * wpa_ctrl_open(const char *ctrl_path);
439
440/**
441 * wpa_ctrl_open2 - Open a control interface to wpa_supplicant/hostapd
442 * @ctrl_path: Path for UNIX domain sockets; ignored if UDP sockets are used.
443 * @cli_path: Path for client UNIX domain sockets; ignored if UDP socket
444 * is used.
445 * Returns: Pointer to abstract control interface data or %NULL on failure
446 *
447 * This function is used to open a control interface to wpa_supplicant/hostapd
448 * when the socket path for client need to be specified explicitly. Default
449 * ctrl_path is usually /var/run/wpa_supplicant or /var/run/hostapd and client
450 * socket path is /tmp.
451 */
452struct wpa_ctrl * wpa_ctrl_open2(const char *ctrl_path, const char *cli_path);
453
454
455/**
456 * wpa_ctrl_close - Close a control interface to wpa_supplicant/hostapd
457 * @ctrl: Control interface data from wpa_ctrl_open()
458 *
459 * This function is used to close a control interface.
460 */
461void wpa_ctrl_close(struct wpa_ctrl *ctrl);
462
463
464/**
465 * wpa_ctrl_request - Send a command to wpa_supplicant/hostapd
466 * @ctrl: Control interface data from wpa_ctrl_open()
467 * @cmd: Command; usually, ASCII text, e.g., "PING"
468 * @cmd_len: Length of the cmd in bytes
469 * @reply: Buffer for the response
470 * @reply_len: Reply buffer length
471 * @msg_cb: Callback function for unsolicited messages or %NULL if not used
472 * Returns: 0 on success, -1 on error (send or receive failed), -2 on timeout
473 *
474 * This function is used to send commands to wpa_supplicant/hostapd. Received
475 * response will be written to reply and reply_len is set to the actual length
476 * of the reply. This function will block for up to 10 seconds while waiting
477 * for the reply. If unsolicited messages are received, the blocking time may
478 * be longer.
479 *
480 * msg_cb can be used to register a callback function that will be called for
481 * unsolicited messages received while waiting for the command response. These
482 * messages may be received if wpa_ctrl_request() is called at the same time as
483 * wpa_supplicant/hostapd is sending such a message. This can happen only if
484 * the program has used wpa_ctrl_attach() to register itself as a monitor for
485 * event messages. Alternatively to msg_cb, programs can register two control
486 * interface connections and use one of them for commands and the other one for
487 * receiving event messages, in other words, call wpa_ctrl_attach() only for
488 * the control interface connection that will be used for event messages.
489 */
490int wpa_ctrl_request(struct wpa_ctrl *ctrl, const char *cmd, size_t cmd_len,
491 char *reply, size_t *reply_len,
492 void (*msg_cb)(char *msg, size_t len));
493
494
495/**
496 * wpa_ctrl_attach - Register as an event monitor for the control interface
497 * @ctrl: Control interface data from wpa_ctrl_open()
498 * Returns: 0 on success, -1 on failure, -2 on timeout
499 *
500 * This function registers the control interface connection as a monitor for
501 * wpa_supplicant/hostapd events. After a success wpa_ctrl_attach() call, the
502 * control interface connection starts receiving event messages that can be
503 * read with wpa_ctrl_recv().
504 */
505int wpa_ctrl_attach(struct wpa_ctrl *ctrl);
506
507
508/**
509 * wpa_ctrl_detach - Unregister event monitor from the control interface
510 * @ctrl: Control interface data from wpa_ctrl_open()
511 * Returns: 0 on success, -1 on failure, -2 on timeout
512 *
513 * This function unregisters the control interface connection as a monitor for
514 * wpa_supplicant/hostapd events, i.e., cancels the registration done with
515 * wpa_ctrl_attach().
516 */
517int wpa_ctrl_detach(struct wpa_ctrl *ctrl);
518
519
520/**
521 * wpa_ctrl_recv - Receive a pending control interface message
522 * @ctrl: Control interface data from wpa_ctrl_open()
523 * @reply: Buffer for the message data
524 * @reply_len: Length of the reply buffer
525 * Returns: 0 on success, -1 on failure
526 *
527 * This function will receive a pending control interface message. The received
528 * response will be written to reply and reply_len is set to the actual length
529 * of the reply.
530
531 * wpa_ctrl_recv() is only used for event messages, i.e., wpa_ctrl_attach()
532 * must have been used to register the control interface as an event monitor.
533 */
534int wpa_ctrl_recv(struct wpa_ctrl *ctrl, char *reply, size_t *reply_len);
535
536
537/**
538 * wpa_ctrl_pending - Check whether there are pending event messages
539 * @ctrl: Control interface data from wpa_ctrl_open()
540 * Returns: 1 if there are pending messages, 0 if no, or -1 on error
541 *
542 * This function will check whether there are any pending control interface
543 * message available to be received with wpa_ctrl_recv(). wpa_ctrl_pending() is
544 * only used for event messages, i.e., wpa_ctrl_attach() must have been used to
545 * register the control interface as an event monitor.
546 */
547int wpa_ctrl_pending(struct wpa_ctrl *ctrl);
548
549
550/**
551 * wpa_ctrl_get_fd - Get file descriptor used by the control interface
552 * @ctrl: Control interface data from wpa_ctrl_open()
553 * Returns: File descriptor used for the connection
554 *
555 * This function can be used to get the file descriptor that is used for the
556 * control interface connection. The returned value can be used, e.g., with
557 * select() while waiting for multiple events.
558 *
559 * The returned file descriptor must not be used directly for sending or
560 * receiving packets; instead, the library functions wpa_ctrl_request() and
561 * wpa_ctrl_recv() must be used for this.
562 */
563int wpa_ctrl_get_fd(struct wpa_ctrl *ctrl);
564
565#ifdef ANDROID
566/**
567 * wpa_ctrl_cleanup() - Delete any local UNIX domain socket files that
568 * may be left over from clients that were previously connected to
569 * wpa_supplicant. This keeps these files from being orphaned in the
570 * event of crashes that prevented them from being removed as part
571 * of the normal orderly shutdown.
572 */
573void wpa_ctrl_cleanup(void);
574#endif /* ANDROID */
575
576#ifdef CONFIG_CTRL_IFACE_UDP
577/* Port range for multiple wpa_supplicant instances and multiple VIFs */
578#define WPA_CTRL_IFACE_PORT 9877
579#define WPA_CTRL_IFACE_PORT_LIMIT 50 /* decremented from start */
580#define WPA_GLOBAL_CTRL_IFACE_PORT 9878
581#define WPA_GLOBAL_CTRL_IFACE_PORT_LIMIT 20 /* incremented from start */
582
583char * wpa_ctrl_get_remote_ifname(struct wpa_ctrl *ctrl);
584#endif /* CONFIG_CTRL_IFACE_UDP */
585
586
587#ifdef __cplusplus
588}
589#endif
590
591#endif /* WPA_CTRL_H */
